intro: Purdiaea microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaf purdiaea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish to brownish flower heads that are typically borne on slender, upright stems. Its leaves are narrow, lance-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Purdiaea microphylla thrives in moist, sandy soils and is often found in open woods and along stream banks.
